text:
Man Utd midfielder Ander Herrera 'so happy' Jose Mourinho took a gamble on him Herrera is flourishing in a more defensive role Credit: Reuters Luke Edwards  30pm 
A nder Herrera has revealed he is delighted Jose Mourinho took a gamble and transformed his Manchester United career by reinventing him as a defensive midfielder. 
Herrera, who had been infuriatingly inconsistent under Louis van Gaal, has enjoyed his best season at Old Trafford since a £29m move from Atletico Bilbao in 2014 and the decision to push him into a deeper role has proved an inspired one by Mourinho. 
Some players, particularly those who have grown up playing in a more attacking and creative position, would have resented the switch, but Herrera has been superb, revealing unseen qualities as a destructively reassuring presence in front of the back four. 
Rather than shrink his game, the 27-year-old claimed it has widened his perspective and with a regular place in the Spain squad an added reward for his excellent club form, Herrera is full of appreciation for his manager, who he is convinced, will be a huge success at United this season and beyond. Herrera is now a regular in the Spain squad Credit: Getty Images 
“I think all of you have seen that since the beginning of the season, after a few games my role changes,” said Herrera. “The manager has helped me a lot to get the knowledge about that role. 
“I am so happy to be a bit more of a defensive player than last season. I can share my energy with the team in that position. He has been great for me, but not just for me, the team as well. 
“My first two seasons here I played 71 games, so it’s not a bad number of games. But, of course, I cannot lie. This is the time I am enjoying most at Man United. 
“I try to be aggressive, whenever we lose the ball I try to get it back always, but sometimes when the see [read] the football [game], you can recover more possession. Watch | Leicester City v Manchester United: key match stats 01:02 
“It is just about position – my football has been aggressive, but in a good way. I never want to get an opponent injured, but I am aggressive and always looking for the ball. 
“This season I’m getting a lot of minutes on the pitch, I think I’m the fourth in the team in terms of minutes.” 
U nited are almost certainly out of the title race given they are 14 points behind leaders Chelsea, who Herrera argued, were the only side which has deserved to beat them this season. 
But having progressed to the knockout phase of the Europa League, which resumes later this month when they take French side St Etienne, and into the last 16 of the FA Cup, Herrera believes Mourinho’s first season as manager is going to be a successful one. 
Much, though, will ultimately depend on whether they can secure Champions League football, with Herrera suggesting it should be, given United’s history, via a top four finish. United are still battling in the Europa League Credit: Rex Features 
“Of course, the Premier League, for everyone is the most important,” added Herrera. “And the one the people likes the most. But we’re still alive in three competitions. 
“When we are on the pitch you can recognise a big team playing. OK, sometimes we don’t win but we are always the protagonist team, we are always getting more chances than the opponent. 
“Almost always – I just remember Liverpool away was different, but most games if I am not wrong - we have had more possession than our opponents. 
“Normally the keeper of the opponent has been their best player, so that shows we are a big team. We are playing always attacking football and sooner or later the goals will come. They came against Leicester but I think we deserved to get some victories before that as well. 
“We have three competitions to play for and in the Premier League we have to finish in the top four,” he added. We will not be 100% happy if we are fourth because we want to finish as high as possible, but minimum, we have to be in the top four and fight for the rest of the titles.” 
A nder Herrera was speaking at the unveiling of the TAG Heuer Manchester United Watch Collection.
